conclusion: Introduction to the problem of determining which blocks the car will collide with and where it will stop.

The car is entering from the lower right and moving towards the group of blocks.

Consideration of physics: gravity, friction, and their effects on the car's movement.
When the car collides with a block, it transfers kinetic energy to the block, causing movement.
The car will be deflected based on the angle and force of the collision.
Consideration of the mass of the car and blocks and momentum transfer during collisions.
Assumption that blocks are stationary and the car's momentum will be transferred during collisions.

The car might approach another block, like the green one, and repeat the collision process.
